headline: Toxic environment, bad management
pros: Nothing that I can think about.
cons:
1. Poor management 
 2. Poor staff welfare
 3. Poor resident quality of life
 4. Poor staff management during COVID period
 5. Poor clinical guidance 
 6. High turnover rate
 7. Too much work politics
 8. You would always be doing other people’s job which snowballs and then management will start complaining that you have poor time management 
 9. Felt unsafe and very unprotected by the management. When things happen, there would always be finger pointing and no one will care what happens to you
10. Management themselves don’t know what they want and keep on flipping their story from time to time

headline: A good company to work for.
pros: Good pay, wonderful people to work for and with

headline: Better
pros: Improved and will continue to recommend others.
cons: Same culture, so this needs to change.

headline: Manager
pros: Excellent Customer Service all the time
cons: Needs to be upgraded in technology

headline: Rn
pros: The residents. I love the fast pace and interacting with others
cons: Short staffed.  Negativity prevails a lot of times. Not enough training

headline: Staffing Coordinator
pros: The elderly that lives in long term facilities
cons: Lack of professional ethics, no team work, poor management

headline: Excellent Company
pros: The employees are treated very fairly. Most managers have an open door policy. Good benefits.
cons: Wish they had more offices in the south

headline: Registered Nurse
pros: Upward mobility possible if you are competent and motivated.
cons: Upper management criticises performance without bothering to ever leaving their office to come out onto the nursing units.  The have unrealistic expectations and offer no assistance in fulfilling all that needs done.  There are no new staff being hired to replace the ones that quite only increasing the work load of those who stay.
